alert.note: Alert for Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:42PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Susquehanna, eastern Bradford and northwestern Wyoming Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 242 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wysox, or near Towanda, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Towanda, Wysox, Hollenback, North Towanda, Herrick, Wyalusing, Monroe, Rome, Laceyville and Le Raysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
